Module io.github.darvil.lanat
Package io.github.darvil.lanat.utils.errors

Interface ErrorContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of error level provider
All Known Implementing Classes:
ActionArgumentType, Argument, ArgumentParser, ArgumentType, BooleanArgumentType, ByteArgumentType, Command, CounterArgumentType, DoubleArgumentType, EnumArgumentType, ErrorContainerImpl, FileArgumentType, FloatArgumentType, FromParseableArgumentType, IntegerArgumentType, KeyValuesArgumentType, LongArgumentType, NumberArgumentType, NumberRangeArgumentType, OptListArgumentType, Parser, ParsingStateBase, ShortArgumentType, SimpleArgumentType, SingleValueListArgumentType, StdinArgumentType, StringArgumentType, Tokenizer, TryParseArgumentType, TupleArgumentType
public interface ErrorContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
Represents a container of errors. Methods are provided to get the errors under a certain level, and to check if there are errors under a certain level.

    • addError

      Adds an error to the list of errors.
      Parameters:

    • getErrorsUnderExitThreshold

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderExitThreshold()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the exit level defined in this error container. These are errors that would cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the exit level

    • getErrorsUnderDisplayThreshold

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderDisplayThreshold()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the display level defined in this error container. These are errors that would be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the display level

    • hasExitErrors

      boolean hasExitErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the exit level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are exit errors

    • hasDisplayErrors

      boolean hasDisplayErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the display level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are display errors

    • setErrorExitThreshold

      void setErrorExitThreshold(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      Specify the error level threshold at which the program should exit. All errors with a level equal to or higher than this will cause the program to exit. For example, if this is set to ErrorLevel.WARNING, then errors including ErrorLevel.WARNING and ErrorLevel.ERROR will cause the program to exit, but ErrorLevel.INFO and below will not.
      Parameters:
      level - The threshold error level at which the program should exit.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the exit threshold is set lower than the display threshold.

    • getErrorExitThreshold

      @NotNull @NotNull io.github.darvil.utils.ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel> getErrorExitThreshold()
      Returns the threshold error level that will cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      the error exit threshold

    • setErrorDisplayThreshold

      void setErrorDisplayThreshold(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      Specify the error level threshold at which errors should be displayed to the user. All errors with a level lower than this will be ignored. For example, if this is set to ErrorLevel.INFO, then errors including ErrorLevel.INFO, ErrorLevel.WARNING, and ErrorLevel.ERROR) will be displayed, but ErrorLevel.DEBUG will not.
      Parameters:
      level - The threshold error level at which errors should be displayed to the user.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the display threshold is set lower than the exit threshold.

    • getErrorDisplayThreshold

      @NotNull @NotNull io.github.darvil.utils.ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel> getErrorDisplayThreshold()
      Returns the threshold error level at which errors will be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      the error display threshold
